places_with_reviews.name: Hotel Amit Park International
address: 26, Shivnath Complex, Beside Nigam, G. E. Road, Dist, Akash Ganga, Supela, Bhilai, Chhattisgarh 490023, India

reviews.text: Undoubtedly the best place to stay at Bhilai in terms of luxury, comfort and value for money. This is located very close to the highway. The rooms are spacious. The check in process was very smooth. The staff was polite. The hotel is clean and well maintained. The hotel has its own restaurant and a bar. There is also a fitness centre in the adjacent building. The complimentary breakfast provided was tasty. There are plenty of options on the menu for in room dining. The prices are very reasonable. They have ample parking space and also parking at the basement. Overall, a good stay experience and would want to stay here again.

This is a luxury hotel and the ambience is great. Food quality and taste is always awesome. However, when it comes to service, it's very poor. Most of the serving staff of the restaurant is over worked and it takes them a lot of time to serve your food. About 50- 60 minutes. So visit this place only if you have a lot of time.
Also, they switched off the lights in the lobby, wash room and most of the restaurant before they served our food. At least four other families were having their dinner at that time.
If there was minus marking for service I would have given that.

Best place to dine in Bhilai. Atharv venue is awesome for party and celebration. Very tasty and delicious veg and non-veg food. Courteous, decent, well-mannered staff and very quick service. Management is too good. Free and guided parking. Would highly recommend this place for party, celebration and dining also.

Reception people are hopeless. I have asked for checkout at 7.35 am and ask for luggage. Just after chasing I could get my luggage from room at 8.19 am. Such a poor service.
Lights in toilet is not sufficient
Food quality is good

The food is average, and degrading day by day... the parking is only available for 4-5 cars, with no valer service, parking here is a pain, with guards only sending from one place to other, and will have to walk under dark if you're here to attend an evening event... Pathetic experience regarding parking and with food quality degrading, management sure has to review the arrangements

places_with_reviews.name: Grand Dhillon
address: A-1, Nehru Nagar Square, G.E. Road, Priyadarsani Parisar West, Priyadarsani Parisar West, Bhilai, Chhattisgarh 490020, India

reviews.text: During my stay at Hotel Grand Dhillon, Mr. Tushar, Mr. Deepak, and Ms. Mehek, along with the excellent housekeeping staff, went above and beyond to make me feel at home. Despite being a three-star hotel, their exceptional service exceeded all expectations. From check-in to checkout, they provided personalized attention and assistance, making my stay truly memorable. Their warmth and professionalism, combined with the hotel's comfortable accommodations, created a welcoming atmosphere. Additionally, the ala carte menu for room service was also excellent, adding to the overall experience. I highly recommend Hotel Grand Dhillon to anyone seeking a memorable and enjoyable stay in Bhillai.

Dhillon recently opened a cafe on the first floor. I went on a work date with a friend. It’s a quite place to work and charging points are also available. You’ll usually find wraps filled with mediocre cold cuts and limp lettuce but the wrap I had was lil spiced with vibrant ingredients. Hot chocolate was first-rate with balanced sweetness. Croissant was wispy. Would recommend this place if you are looking for a change to work.
P.S. - got a complimentary brownie.

We had a fantastic experience during our stay. We thoroughly enjoyed the service, facilities, courteous staff, and especially the delicious food. Chef Naresh's recommendations were absolutely outstanding.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at the 7th Floor Bar and Restaurant in Bhilai and I must say, it was an exceptional experience. The ambiance of the restaurant is simply stunning, with a breathtaking view from the 7th floor. The decor is modern and stylish, creating a very inviting atmosphere.

The food was absolutely delicious. I tried a variety of dishes from their menu and each one was expertly prepared and bursting with flavor. The presentation of the dishes was also very impressive, showcasing the attention to detail that goes into every meal.

The service was top-notch as well. The staff was attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu. They made sure that my dining experience was nothing short of perfect.

Overall, I would highly recommend the 7th Floor Bar and Restaurant.

The hotel was very clean, from the lobby to the restaurant, bar, and each room, and every detail of our request was promptly responded to with a smile. I had a very comfortable stay. A big thank you to Annu, Hema, Mehak, Deepak, Vinay and all the hotel staff.

places_with_reviews.name: Samaira Inn
address: Plot No. - 19\22, Ward No. 23, Pragati Nagar, Risali, Bhilai, Chhattisgarh 490006, India

reviews.text: The entire hotel was covered with glass with no AC on and hence it was difficult to sit in the corridors.  Also, the basic amenities were missing like Geyser  was not funtioning, following were not provided (soap,Shampoo,Dental kit,etc). The key card of the doors were not working properly. Only good thing was food. The food was delicious

Didn't like the place at all. When we got there and ordered food, starters came around 45 mins late. The main course came around 1 hour after the starters.

A new restaurant opened inside Samaira Inn on 14th February which made non-veg dishes available there, we all were excited to try them out. But almost all the chicken and fish dishes we ordered whether starters or main course, came improperly cooked and bland in taste.

Not at all satisfied with the service. We ordered dal tadka, but they gave us dal fry. At that point we all were too hungry to reorder it. We ordered steamed rice which took 20-30 mins to arrive.

Horrible experience with the hotel. The staff is very rowdy and rude in behavior. The property was badly maintained, including amenities. Geysers in rooms don’t work; they provide an immersion rod to heat water. My in-laws, who came from Northeastern India, were inadvertently harassed by hotel staff for burning a towel with an immersion rod, and Rs 500 has been taken as compensation. These kinds of hotels give a bad name to Bhilai, and they lack professionalism to work in the hospitality sector. Please stay away!

I recently organized a marriage reception event at Samaira Inn, my overall experience is very pathetic, all the staff are uneducated and not even the management team, the general manager is overall unresponsive, all my guests in my 600 person wedding reception Waiting for food from last 1 hour but hotel team is not serving food, please Bhilai people do not make this hotel for any wedding reception function, all my guests, even my brother in law are imagining your staff.....

Thankyou
Suresh bisoi
Pune
Just for the restaurant in it. It smelled and didn't have a variety of food options. Also waiters were not knowledgeable in serving portions.

places_with_reviews.name: Hotel Central Park
address: 29, Shivnath Complex, GE Road, Supela, Akash Ganga, Supela, Bhilai, Chhattisgarh 490023, India

reviews.text: Reception was too good for a hotel like this but they also provide hall services for family events so it's understandable. Hotel rooms are just good. Nothing exceptional. Basic amenities like water bottles, glasses, towels, body wash, hair shampoo, hand wash were already their. But the quality of TV (under average Chinese TV) and cable service provider was meeh. Complementary breakfast was a time saver for me. They also have a restaurant where you can choose either dine in or order to room. Prices are slightly higher than outside but quality definitely justifies the price. Getting hot water immediately is tricky. You've to waste a whole bucket of water to get hot water which I don't like. They're probably using solar water heaters for all the rooms so. Cleanliness was pretty good. They cleaned the room next day while I was at work without my permission. They didn't even called me to ask and yes, I had the room key with me. It's a good thing for me but for those who like some privacy of their stuff would be annoying. Overall it was a pleasant stay and the cost was alright. Staff behaviour was good. Location of the hotel is pretty good too.
We had a party in the banquet hall. Overall it is ok. Not an impressive management. It is not the worst I would say but as impressive as well.

Their food tastes the worst of all time. The behaviour of the staff is very bad They make bad comments on girls as misbehaved.They don't even listen to complaints. And the food is yuck 🤮.
They don't have manners to talk and behave with their guest.

If you're a student or planning to do any kind of party don't do it here .

Visited the restaurant for lunch.
Food was pretty good in taste but service was a bit of a problem.
The place was pretty empty and only one staff member was available which could only take and bring order and couldn't find time for service. Other staff were busy in sudden party, as conveyed.
Never ever try a mocktail here , it's totally packaged mixing and no original flavours.Roasted papad was medium sized, normally it's large one and the papad were old enough. Spring rolls were almost zero oil , that was very nice and surprising but it's small cutting threw all the stuffing out. Soups were pretty good.
Snacks were good in taste. Rotis were cold, due to high service time. Cooking time was more, hence the delay between snacks and lunch.
The ambience is neat and good. Once in a while can visit with groups. Portion size is good enough.
Nice ambience.nice food..supportive staff.rooms are spacious..hygene maintenance good..,,

places_with_reviews.name: Hotel Nikhil Regency
address: NH53, near Power House, Janjgiri, Bhilai, Chhattisgarh 490001, India

reviews.text: Recently I visited the Property and surprisingly it was good to notice the atmosphere at the Property. First of all the cleanliness was excellent which refreshed the exertion after long travel. Secondly the reception staff behaviour was excellent. Specially their gesture and helping nature. It was a very good experience at the Property. Due to official works I couldn't stay long but the overall experience was too good.
Good place for overnight stops. Pet friendly. (They charge ₹500 for pet). Room service ok.. in room free breakfast is good.

I stayed in Nikhil Regency during my recent visit to Bhilai.

Pro:
1. The hotel location is at the highway so thats a plus point for them.
2. It is not very expensive hotel.
3. Goibibo allowed me to book it for 1₹ initially and did not forced ne to pay the whole amount while booking.
4. Beautiful hall for party and function.

Cons:
1. The front desk staff is not professional at all. They are actually rude.
2. They charge GST on all items. Even on items with MRP(All taxes are by default included in MRP)
3. I don’t think they changed rooms bedsheets regularly.
4. Unhygienic Bathroom.
5. They provided some random brand water bottles for guests.
6. No in house parking.
7. They will ask stupid questions about the guests staying in same room irrespective of their age.
8. Even after submitting identity proof they will ask you to self-attest the copies. There is no need/law for this.
9. No scenic view from room window.

The very bad experience in this hotel.They don't know the meaning of hospitality .Their manager named toshiq doesn't know how to talk with guest. I am sharing my experience with him when I and my guest was going to my room he shout from the reception and said me what about payment.This is very bad. Service was very pathetic.I called from my room twice that wi fi is not working and the staff said that electrician is coming but no body came. And in morning at the time I talked to Mr Toshiq who was manager at that time said that wire of wi fi is loose.But in last strange this is that they don't know the meaning of higen.when I was leaving from reception I saw that the packets of milk and curd was lying on the floor. I advise you that please don't visit this place if you have harden money

I recently stayed at this hotel, and I must say I was quite disappointed with my experience. The receptionist's behavior was completely rude and unprofessional. It felt like she had no idea how to speak with customers, and her attitude left a lot to be desired.

Furthermore, the rooms were surprisingly small. I felt cramped and uncomfortable throughout my stay, which didn't make for a pleasant experience. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this hotel based on my recent visit. It's essential for a hotel to provide a welcoming atmosphere and comfortable accommodations, and unfortunately, this one fell short on both fronts.
